nodes.text: That's what bothers me so much about the pro-choice position on personhood regarding a fetus: there is an obvious double-standard. They seem to have no problem with the idea of it being a person when a murderer is convicted of two murders in case of killing a pregnant woman, but they refuse to allow for personhood with the fetus when it comes to the abortion issue. At least they could be consistent.

Actually, we do. These inconsistant laws are a product of pro-life people trying to create a stepping stone to a national ban. Crimes against pregnant women should warrant a more serious offense, not an entirely new offense.
